articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 1973
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 1973
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, inspected the command of KPA Unit 1973 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment on Friday.
					 He gave a pair of binoculars, an automatic rifle and a machine gun to a sub-unit directly under the unit as gifts before having a photo session with its service personnel.
					
					 After being briefed by its commanding officers on the monument to field guidance erected for handing down to posterity the immortal exploits of leader Kim Jong Il, who visited the unit on May 23, 2003, he looked round the rooms devoted to the education in the revolutionary history and the unit's history.
					
					 Kim Jong Un recalled that Kim Jong Il watched the unit's street battle training on November 30, 2011, the last period of his life. He looked back on the unforgettable day when he visited the drill ground, accompanying Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He underscored the need for the unit to glorify the undying exploits of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il with a proud victory in a great war for national reunification.
					
					 He highly praised the unit for having always taken the lead in upholding the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Party.
					
					 He said the Generalissimos attached importance to this unit and it is the unit he regards as the most important and the Party trusts, adding that his inspection of the unit today has a profound meaning.
					
					 He looked round the soldiers' hall, library and a place for educating them as heroes.
					
					 Watching with keen attention photos of exemplary book readers at the library, he praised the unit for operating the library well.
					
					 At the place for educating soldiers as heroes he was told that the unit produced 189 heroes of the republic and labor heroes and 19 recipients of the National Reunification Prize and that it has 21 hero companies. Saying that the unit has quite a lot of heroes, he reposed deep trust in it, urging it to become a hero unit in the battle for making a breakthrough in a great war for national reunification in the future.
					
					 At the soldiers' hall he underlined the need for the unit to fully prepare all its service personnel as those strong in idea and faith and members of a scouting party and a death-defying corps for national reunification fully equipped with the spirit of defending the socialist country by continuously paying primary attention to their political and ideological education.
					
					 Asking about how education is conducted by the O Jung Hup Political University, he clarified the issues of properly working out the education program suited to the nature of the unit, successfully building ranks of teachers and improving their qualifications.
					
					 Soldiers of the unit who should fight in the enemy-controlled areas can creditably perform their mission only when they are fully prepared not only in military technology and physically but politically and ideologically, he noted.
					
					 Watching a topographic relief map showing enemy-controlled areas and the operational plan of the unit at the military lecture hall, he listened to a detailed report on the unit's performance of the operational combat duties and trainings from the commander of the unit.
					
					 Stressing the unit has an important mission to conquer the strongholds of the enemy, he said once a war breaks out, the unit should storm the heart of the enemies in a flash to strike and destroy the targeted military installations and reactionary ruling institutions of the puppet regime at a lightning speed.
					
					 He instructed the unit to correctly set major objects of its strike and grasp all major targets.
					
					 He underscored the need to properly work out a training program suited to the features of the unit's performance of duty and conduct training under the simulated conditions of an actual battle to prepare combatants in such a way as to enable them to operate freely in the enemy-controlled areas in case of emergency.
					
					 Going round the sub-unit directly under the unit, he stressed the need to take good care of the living of the soldiers of the unit who would fight in the enemy-controlled areas.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the service personnel of the unit would demonstrate the mettle of the heroic KPA in a decisive battle with the enemies and defend the dear socialist homeland as firm as an iron wall.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Hwang Pyong So and Pak Jong Chon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Site for Reclaiming Sepho Tableland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Site for Reclaiming Sepho Tableland 
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent lots of vehicles, farming materials and essential goods as gifts to the service personnel and builders active in the project for reclaiming Sepho Tableland, true to the call of the Workers' Party of Korea, in the wake of showing deep trust and loving care for them.
					 A ceremony of conveying the gifts took place on the spot on Friday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and other officials concerned, service personnel of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, builders and residents in Sepho County.

articles.title: Message of Condolences to Bangladeshi PM
articles.content:
Message of Condolence to Bangladeshi PM
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message to Sheikh Hasina, prime minister of Bangladesh, expressing condolences over the death of President Zillur Rahman.
					 Kim Yong Nam in his message expressed deep condolences to the prime minister and, through her, to the bereaved families and the Bangladeshi people, upon hearing the sad news that the president passed to their sorrow.
					
					 Though Zillur Rahman passed away, his exploits for the country and nation will always be remembered by the people, the message said.

articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari on the day of Pakistan.
					 The message wished the president and the people of Pakistan greater success in their work for the country's prosperity, expressing conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani PM
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday sent a message of greeting to Pakistani Prime Minister Raza Pervez Ashraf on the day of Pakistan.
					 The message wished the prime minister and the government of Pakistan greater success in their work for the country's prosperity and the people's wellbeing in the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Introduction of Agro-forestry Management Method
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Introduction of Agro-forestry Management Method
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim made a field survey of the agro-forestry management method in Suan County, North Hwanghae Province.
					 Officials and other agricultural workers in Suan County cultivated trees, crops and herbs in forests in touch with the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation to improve ecological environment and introduced agro-forestry management method, a new form of forestry management for boosting the production of  grain and varieties of raw materials for industry. They have benefited from it.
					
					 The premier acquainted himself with the county's cultivation and use of larch and pine nut trees and maize and other crops in many areas. He watched a video showing the agro-forestry management method prepared by the ministry.
					
					 Then followed a meeting. He stressed the need to positively introduce the agro-forestry management method the efficiency of which has been proved and turn mountains into a thick woodland in a short span of time and contribute to improving the standard of people's living, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on turning all mountains of the country into those of treasure and the grand plan of the dear respected Kim Jong Un for nature-harnessing.

articles.title: Congratulations to New Maltese FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to New Maltese FM
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to George Vella on his appointment as foreign minister of Malta.
					 The message wished the Maltese foreign minister success in his new office, expressing belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow on good terms.

articles.title: UN Human Rights Council's "Resolution on Human Rights" against DPRK Rejected by DPRK FM Spokesman
articles.content:
UN Human Rights Council's "Resolution on Human Rights" against DPRK Rejected by DPRK FM Spokesman
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry Friday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the very provocative "resolution" against the DPRK adopted at a session of the UN Human Rights Council:
					 The 22nd session of the UN Human Rights Council on Thursday adopted a "resolution" which calls for forming a "commission of inquiry" on the basis of all sorts of false materials slandering the DPRK.
					
					 The "resolution on human rights" against the DPRK cooked up by the U.S. and its allies every year with inveterate repugnancy and hostility towards the DPRK is a political chicanery which does not deserve even a passing note.
					
					 The U.S., driven into a tight corner by a series of setbacks sustained by it in the political and military confrontation with the DPRK, is kicking up an anti-DPRK human rights campaign involving its allies in a ridiculous bid to hurt the DPRK.
					
					 We will as always totally reject and disregard the recent "human rights resolution" against the DPRK, a product of political confrontation and conspiracy.
					
					 The U.S. and the West have slandered the socialist countries over their "human rights issue" since the era of the Cold War. Their adoption of the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution", a manifestation of their inveterate bad habit, simply betrays their base and vulgar practice of abusing the human rights, the noble concept of mankind, for their sinister political purpose.
					
					 If the UN Human Rights Council is to discharge its mission, it should put an end to the farce of adopting anti-DPRK "human rights resolutions", the height of politicization and selectivity of human rights and double standards, and take issue with the U.S. violation of sovereignty of other states in different parts of the world, to begin with.
					
					 The ceaseless evil cycle of terrorism and revenge in those countries which turned into scenes of destruction and murder due to the aggression and interference by outside forces and the tragic human rights performance arousing serious concern of the international community clearly prove how serious the consequences of violation of sovereignty of other states are.
					
					 The ever-escalating hostile acts of the U.S. to bring down the ideology and system chosen by the Korean people will only intensify their all-out action against the U.S.

articles.title: Senior Party and State Officials Visit National Exhibition of Consumer Goods
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit National Exhibition of Consumer Goods
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior party and state officials and officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions visited the national exhibition of consumer goods on March 20 and 22. 
					 It was open at the Three-Revolution Exhibition with splendor. On display there are at least 142 000 items of consumer goods produced by light industrial establishments in Pyongyang and local areas. 
					
					 The visitors went round exhibition stands fully stacked with vinalon products, velvet cloth, shoes, seasonal clothes, sportswear, foodstuffs, cosmetics and household utensils. 
					
					 Popular among visitors were products from provincial combined foodstuff factories and Changsong County which made big contributions to producing consumer goods by developing local industry. 
					
					 Those consumer goods produced through the creative ingenuity of masses and the tapping of internal reserves clearly proved the validity and vitality of the August 3 Consumer Goods Production Movement.

articles.title: U.S. Last-ditch Efforts to Escalate Military Threat to DPRK: News Analyst
articles.content:
U.S. Last-ditch Efforts to Escalate Military Threat to DPRK: News Analyst
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is now making last-ditch efforts to escalate its military threat to the DPRK, taken aback by the latter's will to take toughest counteractions.
					 On March 19, B-52 of the U.S. forces flew into south Korea to get involved in a drill under the simulated conditions of dropping nuclear bombs on the DPRK.
					
					 The drill was reportedly staged as part of the on-going madcap Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					
					 In this regard the U.S. deputy secretary of Defense blustered that the U.S. remains transparent in its will to defend south Korea and its defense commitment is steadily maintained against the backdrop of ceaseless threat from north Korea.
					
					 A spokesman for the U.S. Department of Defense at a press conference asserted that B-52s' flight into south Korea was to examine their nuclear and conventional capabilities, adding that their drill was aimed to call attention to the fact that the U.S. has extended deterrent capability to cope with the recent threat of north Korea and to show its will to defend south Korea.
					
					 On the same day, the U.S. launched spy satellite GEO-2 for the purpose of intensifying espionage against the DPRK.
					
					 The satellite is reportedly tasked to monitor all military moves in the Northern Pacific region with the DPRK as a main target.
					
					 The U.S. claims that by use of the satellite it can detect in advance the DPRK's launch of medium and short range missiles and even daily flights of its fighters.
					
					 As a puppy knows no fear of a tiger, such ridiculous military threat of the U.S. can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK remains undeterred though the U.S. makes much fuss, introducing strategic nuclear strike means and launching spy satellite. The army and people of Songun Korea will never step back from the all-out action against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Such campaign of the U.S. would only reinforce the resolution of the army and people of the DPRK to take revenge upon the enemy. 
					
					 As already declared before the world, the DPRK has nuclear and missile striking capabilities strong enough to resolutely foil any provocation of the U.S. imperialists and wipe out the aggressors to the last man.
					
					 If B-52 flies into the air over the Korean Peninsula again, it will not escape a powerful military counteraction.
					
					 Should the enemies launch an aggression at any cost, the DPRK will give fullest play to the might of Songun to mercilessly punish the aggressors.
					
					 The U.S. had better come to its senses, tough belatedly, and stop at once its adventurous military threat to the DPRK.

articles.title: Corruption Is Prevalent among U.S. Soldiers: News Analyst
articles.content:
Corruption Is Prevalent among U.S. Soldiers: News Analyst
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces are plagued with the gamut of corruption and scandals, being affected by extreme war-phobia and war-weariness.
					 The recent Associated Press figure of military officers who were dismissed for committing sexual assaults, drug and alcohol uses and all other crimes since 2005 showed four out of 10 officers above lieutenant colonel level for the past eight years.
					
					 Those who were dismissed after being charged with sexual assaults accounted for 30 percent.
					
					 Recently 18 generals and admirals were discharged 10 out of which were charged with crimes related to sexual assaults.
					
					 No wonder, a senior official of the U.S. Defense Department said that sexual assaults and other crimes have become a serious issue within the U.S. forces.
					
					 Muddy spring will have muddy streams. 
					
					 Endemic among the U.S. soldiers are sexual assaults, drug abuse and addiction to alcohol which degenerate troop morals.
					
					 The U.S. Defense Secretary confessed that more than 3 100 cases of sexual assaults were reported among U.S. forces in 2011 alone, bringing the number of victims to 19 000.
					
					 According to a report published by the U.S. Defense Department, half of female soldiers who were sent to Iraq and Afghanistan fell victim to sexual harassment.
					
					 Amid the increasing drug abuse, a quarter of U.S. ground soldiers were disclosed to have used sedative against rule.
					
					 Irony is that drugs were prescribed at U.S. military bases, increasing the number of soldiers getting addicted to drugs.
					
					 Also funny is that the U.S. military has got busy forming a special investigation group within the army allegedly to check addiction to alcohol.
					
					 The U.S. misdeeds have sparked off furor worldwide, inviting international condemnation.
					
					 A typical example is GIs' despicable behaviors in Japan and south Korea.
					
					 Last year two members of the U.S. marines in Okinawa assaulted a 20-year old woman, enraging the locals.
					
					 This February a drunken soldier of the U.S. air force in Japan drove a car into another car before being arrested.
					
					 Crimes occurring in an unbroken chain in south Korea arouse strong protest and denunciation of people. When considering the year 2011 alone, in July a soldier in Waegwan U.S. military base in Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province committed a sexual violence against a woman in her 40s and in September a drunken GI raped 18-year old schoolgirl in Tongduchon, Kyonggi Province and a soldier belonging to the U.S. 8th Army stormed a room of a schoolgirl in Mapho District, Seoul where he raped her and fled with a laptop computer.
					
					 Drunken GIs recently brandished lethal weapons and did damage to innocent inhabitants and policemen, arousing furor.
					
					 Much upset by this, the U.S. Forces Commands in Japan and south Korea ordered soldiers to abstain from wine and put in force a nighttime curfew. But it was just like closing the barn after the horse is stolen.
					
					 The true nature of the U.S. forces plagued with corruption can never change.
					
					 It is ridiculous for the U.S. to think of provoking the DPRK with such an army little short of a group of riff-raffs ill famed for corruption and crimes.

articles.title: DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
articles.content:
DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow hosted a reception on Mar. 19 to mark the 64th anniversary of the conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Among those present on invitation were officials of the Foreign Ministry, State Duma, Federal Council, Ministry of Culture, Ministry of Economy and Development, Ministry of Transport, Ministry of Education and Science, Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Russia, Russian Railways Company, Gazprom Company and Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK and other officials concerned.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before a full-length picture of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together. 
					
					 They looked round photos on display under the themes of "Whole Life Dedicated to People" and "Successful Launch of Satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2".

articles.title: Lao Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Lao Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Kiettisak Keobanhdith hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Friday on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP).
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), and other officials concerned.
					
					 The Lao ambassador in his speech recalled that the LPRP has registered successes in the efforts to safeguard revolutionary gains, consolidate and develop the people's democratic system and bolster overall national power since its birth.
					
					 The friendly relations between the LPRP and the WPK were provided by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The party, government and people of Laos will make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK, said the ambassador.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said the foundation of the LPRP was a historic event which brought about a turn in the struggle for carving out the destiny of the Lao people and achieving the independent progress of the country. 
					
					 He extended thanks to the Lao party and people for having invariably supported the WPK and the Korean people in their just cause of building a thriving socialist nation and achieving national reunification.
					
					 He said the dear respected Kim Jong Un pays deep attention to the development of the relations with the Lao party and people, expressing conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two peoples would grow stronger.

articles.title: New Posters Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Posters Produced in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK produced new posters encouraging its people in their efforts to carry out the policies of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The poster "Let us glorify this significant year with increased grain production!" depicts a female agricultural worker holding ripen ears of rice in her arms against the background of celebration fireworks, the fluttering DPRK flag and balloons carrying placards reading "65th anniversary of the DPRK" and "60th anniversary of victory in war."
					
					 The poster calls for focusing all efforts on the agricultural front and mobilizing all forces to reap a rich harvest this year.
					
					 Another poster "Let hot wind of sports sweep whole country!" reflects the will of the people to implement the Party's plan to popularize sports and make it part of their daily life so that the DPRK may emerge a sports power at an early date.

articles.title: Premier Soccer League under Way in DPRK
articles.content:
Premier Soccer League under Way in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Premier soccer league matches are now taking place at Kim Il Sung Stadium and Sosan Football Stadium here as part of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games. 
					 As of March 20, the Kigwancha Sports Team and the Sports Team of the Ministry of Light Industry showed good results in men's matches, leaving April 25 and Sonbong teams behind, which had advanced to the finals at the 12th People's Games.
					
					 In women's matches, the Myohyangsan team is taking the first place with six matches, four wins and two draws, and following it were April 25, Amnokgang and Sobaeksu teams.
					
					 According to a person concerned, the teams at middle class have produced good results so far, going beyond the expectation of experts.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Efforts to Effective Use of Water Resources
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Efforts to Effective Use of Water Resources
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has paid big efforts to developing water resources and making effective use of them.
					 The Law on Water Resources was adopted in the country in June Juche 86 (1997).
					
					 Under the plan of grand nature-remaking project of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway was completed in 2002, as the first gravity-fed irrigation system in the country.
					
					 Over nearly 10 years since then, the government has built many nature-driven waterways, extending some 10 000km, across the country.
					
					 A Nampho-Pyongyang seawater pipeline was laid last year, paving a way to disinfect drinking water with seawater.
					
					 Meanwhile, a nationwide drive has been conducted to prevent water pollution and provide inhabitants with clean water and better environment.
					
					 Water change is carried on in every spring and autumn to prevent rivers and streams from being polluted. Last year saw improvement projects of the Hapjang and Pothong rivers, which helped better the natural environment in Pyongyang City.
					
					 Sewage treatment plants have been updated steadily.
					
					 The country pays attention to river improvement and tree planting as part of the work for conserving water.
					
					 On the occasion of World Water Day (March 22), the government launches a campaign to awaken its people to the importance of conservation and management of water resources.
					
					 The DPRK joined Global Water Partnership in September 2003 with an aim to strengthen international cooperation in the management and conservation of water resources.

articles.title: Scientific Achievements to Be Seen in Light Industy
articles.content:
Scientific Achievements to Be Seen in Light Industy
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- In response to the speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March 18 national meeting of light industrial workers, employees of the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science under the State Academy of Sciences have turned out to effect a surge in scientific research.
					 The Textile Institute concentrates efforts on improving the quality of vinalon fiber and intensifying the research into functional clothes.
					
					 The Textile Machinery Institute launched a work to put textile machines on a high-speed and precision basis and the Foodstuff Institute finished preparing production processes of a processed milk factory to be built on the Sepho tableland while striving to improve the quality of drinks made of potato.
					
					 The Grain Processing Institute and the Aromatic and Cosmetic Institute set new research goals of significance in raising the people's living standard and started the work for hitting the targets.
					
					 Son Kyong Nam, director of the branch academy, told KCNA:
					
					 "Officials and scientists of the branch academy have been greatly encouraged by Marshal Kim Jong Un's historic speech.
					
					 I will do my utmost to contribute to putting the nation's light industry on a new scientific basis, true to his noble intention."

articles.title: Many Children Become Talents in DPRK
articles.content:
Many Children Become Talents in DPRK 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Many kindergarteners and school children in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have grown to be talents.
					 Among them are Kim Yong Hyok, Ri Il Hung, Pang Ryul Gwang and Choe Sin Hyok of the Ponbu Kindergarten in Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province. A collection of handicrafts "Infinite Is Our Happiness", which they made with clay of different colors and leaves, lively features animals, including elephants, pigs and bears.
					
					 Incredible are the brush-handwriting skills of O Kum Song of the Haean Kindergarten in Rason City and Jong Ho Yong and Mun Jin Song of the Ponbu Kindergarten in Sinuiju City. Their brush handwriting is so excellent that it is hard to believe that they are kindergarteners. They are able to vividly represent their feelings with brush.
					
					 Admirable is the collection of instrumentals "Song of Best Wishes", created by Jong Song Hae, a fourth-year student of the Sungrisan Secondary School in Tokchon City, South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Besides, many other collections of songs created by children of primary and secondary schools have enjoyed high appreciation from experts.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Final Victory through Great Army-People Unity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Final Victory through Great Army-People Unity
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday editorially calls upon all service personnel and people to unite around the dear respected Kim Jong Un as firm as a rock to devotedly defend the sovereignty of the country and nation and certainly achieve the historic cause of national reunification.
					 The great army-people unity of the DPRK has reached the highest level in the crucible of all-people resistance, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 Our great army-people unity is the strongest not only in the will of upholding the leader but in sentiment and love for comrades-in-arms. When service personnel come out in a decisive battle, the people respond to it in a do-or-die spirit. They shield each other even under a hail of bullets and shells and donate their blood and flesh to each other without hesitation.
					
					 The present situation in which a great epic of army-people unity is created under the leadership of Kim Jong Un clearly proves that a sure guarantee has been provided for a final victory in the all-out action against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Standing on the right side of Kim Jong Un leading the present all-out action to victory are service personnel and on his left side the heroic people like fortresses and shields.
					
					 Neither reckless moves of the enemies to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK nor psychological warfare to divorce the party from the masses and disturb people's mindset can ever break the will of the army and people to cement their single-minded unity.
					
					 Today we have powerful nuclear deterrent and weapon of unity more powerful than it.
					
					 There can never be the second Armistice Agreement for the DPRK as it has tremendous political and military power incomparable with that in the past Fatherland Liberation War. A final victory is in store for the army and people of the DPRK fighting with the might of great army-people unity, something unprecedented in the world, having the illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu at the helm of the revolution.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Campaign Can Never Be Justified: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Campaign Can Never Be Justified: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- With no rhetoric can the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet regime justify their "sanctions" against the DPRK and joint military exercises for invading it and cover up their true colors as arch criminals and dangerous provokers escalating the tension of the Korean Peninsula. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 Noting that the anti-DPRK "sanctions" are an unpardonable provocation to infringe upon the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and bring down the socialist system chosen by its people, the article goes on:
					
					 In January the U.S. and its allies prodded the UN Security Council into fabricating the brigandish "resolution on sanctions". This has no ground under international law as it is a revelation of deep-rooted hostility and repugnance towards the DPRK and extreme insolence and highhandedness. 
					
					 On March 7, they prodded the UNSC into cooking up another "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its nuclear test. This was something unprecedented and the most blatant challenge to the ideology and social system in the DPRK. The U.S. hostile policy is aimed to disarm the DPRK, stifle it economically and destroy the ideology and social system chosen by its people. The new "resolution on sanctions" is serious and dangerous as it justified the U.S. hostile policy and paved the way for the hostile forces' launch of military action for aggression under the pretext of "nuclear non-proliferation". 
					
					 The large-scale joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces are designed to invade the DPRK by force by leading the criminal economic "sanctions" to a military offensive. 
					
					 The spate of sophism let loose by the U.S. and the south Korean regime is nothing but an artifice to evade the responsibility for the prevailing grave situation, escalate their moves for aggression against the DPRK and thus achieve their criminal purpose.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for Danger of Nuclear War on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for Danger of Nuclear War on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and its allies are to blame for pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a nuclear war.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 The U.S. and other hostile forces are running the whole gamut of rhetoric to evade the responsibility for the prevailing grave situation but that will never help justify their war moves, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Not a few countries have launched thousands of satellites but the UN Security Council has never called them into question.
					
					 It, however, unreasonably took issue with the satellite launch of the DPRK only. This was a proof that the UNSC was abused. Neither advice nor international law could work on the brigandish U.S. imperialists. There should have been only tougher counteractions against them.
					
					 Hence, the DPRK went ahead with its 3rd underground nuclear test in February last.
					
					 Looking back on history, the Korean nation has been exposed to the constant nuclear threat of the U.S.
					
					 It was because of the U.S. nuclear threat that the DPRK withdrew from the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty and had access to the nuclear deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. that spawned and hyped the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and worked desperately to impose the nuclear disaster upon the Korean nation.
					
					 The prevailing situation on the Korean Peninsula has put the DPRK at the crossroads: Whether to protect its supreme interests or suffer a nuclear disaster to be imposed upon it by the U.S. and its allies.
					
					 It is the principled stance of the DPRK to counter the reckless nuclear war racket with a higher precision nuclear attack means. 
					
					 Gone are the days when the DPRK could have verbal exchange with the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. and its allies had better behave themselves.

articles.title: S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Its Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign over Human Rights
articles.content:
S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Its Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign over Human Rights
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Hwang U Ryo, representative of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea, blustered on Tuesday that "it is necessary to certainly railroad through the 19th 'National Assembly' the bill on human rights in the north, not cleared at the 18th NA".
					 Minju Joson Friday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 His remarks are nothing but a product of the wicked plot to prod the opposition parties into passing it through the 19th "National Assembly" without fail and thus justify the anti-DPRK smear campaign over human rights.
					
					 It is a brazen-faced act for the "Saenuri Party" to institute the "law on human rights in the north" over its non-existent human rights issue. The "Saenuri Party"  has taken the lead in turning south Korea into the world's worst tundra of human rights. 
					
					 What merits attention is that it is working hard to plug the opposition parties into a campaign for cooking up the law.
					
					 The above-said bill proposed by the "Saenuri Party" has failed so far to pass through the NA due to the objection of the opposition parties. Their stance reflects the people's mindset. The south Korean people are strongly critical of the "Saenuri Party's" anti-DPRK smear campaign over human rights. It is against this backdrop that the group is instigating the opposition parties to seek the NA carriage of the bill. This is nothing but a despicable artifice to deprive them of popular support.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is now working hard in the direction of making the north-south relations hardly repairable.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will wipe out the ultra-right conservatives of the "Saenuri Party" including Hwang U Ryo once an order is issued to launch a great war for national reunification.

articles.title: U.S. Will Get Nothing from Sanctions against DPRK: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Will Get Nothing from Sanctions against DPRK: KCNA Commentary
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is intensifying the moves to implement the anti-DPRK "resolution on sanctions" over its third nuclear test. 
					 The U.S. and its allies claim that those sanctions are to ensure peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and confined to the field related to the nuclear test, not economic field. However, this cannot cover up the illegality and reactionary nature of their sanctions. 
					
					 The "resolution on sanctions" is a despicable product of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK to disarm and economically stifle it and bring down Korean-style socialism at any cost. 
					
					 The U.S. has slapped economic sanctions against the DPRK for nearly seven decades since the liberation of Korea as it has regarded the DPRK advancing along the way of independence, Songun and socialism as a thorn in its flesh. 
					
					 According to the data published by the Research Service of U.S. Congress in 2006, more than 40 items were included in the sanctions against the DPRK at that time. 
					
					 Sanctions against the DPRK call for restricting and banning dealings in almost fields ranging from military field to equipment of major factories, cutting-edge technology and goods needed for people's living.
					
					  The damages caused to the DPRK by U.S. economic sanctions and blockade have reached astronomical figures.
					
					 The U.S. harsh economic sanctions are hideous crimes against humanity and human rights as they are gravely encroaching upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and its normal economic development and the improvement of people's living standard.
					
					 Whenever an opportunity presents itself, the U.S. is so impudent as to talk about the people's living in the DPRK this or that way. This is the height of shamelessness.
					
					 As a matter of fact but for the U.S. harsh sanctions, the DPRK would have advanced further in economic construction to startle the world people, and the Korean people would have lived better than any others.
					
					 The U.S. is seriously mistaken if it thinks it can expect any "success" from its tightened sanctions against the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK ranked itself among the satellite manufacturers and launchers and nuclear weapons states, demonstrating the might of victor at a time when the enemies' sanctions reached an extreme phase. This is, indeed, a historic miracle. 
					
					 This is ascribable to the immortal and great guiding idea, an eternal and precious revolutionary heritage of the nation handed down by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, illustrious commanders of Mt. Paektu, and the Korean-style unique strategy of national development and economic strategy based on the idea.
					
					 It is a tragedy that the U.S. does not know about the DPRK.
					
					 The all-out action announced by the DPRK is pursuant to the strategic option to definitely terminate not only the U.S. intention to ignite a new war but its hostile moves against the DPRK that have lasted for nearly seven decades and drop the curtain on the DPRK-U.S. confrontation at an early date.
					
					 It is a law of history that justice and truth are sure to triumph and injustice and lie are bound to fail.
					
					 Did fascist Germany and Japan ever imagine their defeats when they behaved arrogantly, invading other countries in the last century?
					
					 The U.S. should draw a due lesson from the confrontation with the heroic DPRK, which brought about a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism for the first time in history.
					
					 The U.S. had better remember golden maxim once again that the history, which failed to draw a lesson, is bound to repeat itself and this will end in tragedy.
					
					 The U.S. will get nothing from its economic sanctions against the DPRK. 
					
					 U.S. imperialism is fated to go to decline and bankruptcy.

articles.title: Action Program Published by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Action Program Published by S. Korean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy of south Korea published this year's action program on March 16.
					 It said that decades have passed since the "yusin" dictatorship ended but the dictatorial rule trampling down the will and demand of the people is going on in south Korea.
					
					 The "Security Law" has become more rampant under the present "government", in particular, it held.
					
					 Referring to the activities conducted by it for democracy of society and people's rights, it said it would wage a dynamic action for the abolition of the SL and the release of all prisoners of conscience this year, too.
					
					 It stressed it would stage a dynamic action to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Achieve National Reunification by Their Concerted Efforts
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Achieve National Reunification by Their Concerted Efforts
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The June 15 Single-minded Mountainous Society for Reunification in south Korea held a rally in Kyonggi Province on March 17 at which it said it would turn out in an action to reunify the country independently.
					 The prevailing tense situation on the Korean Peninsula is attributable to the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the north over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes and nuclear test for self-defence and to the north-targeted Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, war drills for invading the north, the organization held.
					
					 It accused the Lee Myung Bak regime of totally blocking the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration which calls for rejecting outsiders' interference and reunifying the country independently by concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 It underscored the need to conduct a positive action to bring earlier the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Declaration against War Published by S. Korean Students
articles.content:
Declaration against War Published by S. Korean Students
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Students affiliated to the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century on March 17 published a declaration against the north-targeted war maneuvers kicked off by the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers.
					 In the declaration they denounced the U.S. and south Korean military warmongers for pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war, the worst since the ceasefire.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers have staged the Key Resolve drills at a full-dress phase since March 11, compelling the north to take a step for totally nullifying the Armistice Agreement, they noted.
					
					 The absence of the AA, a minimum mechanism for deterring a war, created such situation on the Korean Peninsula that a war may break out anytime, they said.
					
					 They declared that students would turn out in the struggle to prevent a war and defend peace.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean War Moves under Fire
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean War Moves under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Autonomous Society for Korean National Culture in Partizansk City, the Suchan Autonomous Society for Korean National Culture and the Partizansk City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on March 13 jointly sent a letter of protest to the south Korean chief executive.
					 The letter accused the U.S. of turning south Korea into a nuclear arsenal.
					
					 It denounced the U.S. for laying difficulties in the way of the Korean people by operating its military bases in south Korea and stockpiling nuclear weapons there and by making its economy increasingly dependent on the U.S.
					
					 The potential military threat to the peninsula will bring irrevocable consequences to the people of Korea and those of other Asian countries around it, the letter said.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. and south Korean chief executives stop the military provocations escalating the tension on the peninsula.
					
					 There is nothing more urgent for the Korean people than peaceful reunification of the nation, it said.
					
					 Calling on the Korean people to condemn the schemes of the tricksters to bar the peninsula from turning into a zone of peace and prosperity by creating difficulties in the way of national reunification, the letter declared that their strong will alone can deal blows at the aggressors.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Protest against North-targeted War Maneuvers
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Protest against North-targeted War Maneuvers
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification, Mun Se Hyon, chairman of the South Korean Youth League in Japan, and Kim Ji Yong, chairperson of the South Korean Democratic Women's Society in Japan, staged a protest outside the U.S. embassy in Tokyo on March 15 in demand of a halt to the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					 The frantic Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises are large-scale war maneuvers for aggression pursuant to OPLAN 5027 aimed to "topple the north's government", they noted.
					
					 Lurking behind the war maneuvers is the U.S. government's persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK, they said, adding: The U.S. military presence in south Korea and military threat to the north with nukes in disregard of the Armistice Agreement are the basic cause of north-U.S. stand-off.
					
					 They urged the U.S. government to make a switchover in its confrontation policy, stop the north-targeted war maneuvers increasing the danger of war and opt for dialogue to ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: U.S. Policy of Double-Standards Proves Futile in DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Policy of Double-Standards Proves Futile in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Mohammad Salim, director of the Asian Institute of the College of Social Sciences of Kuwait University, said after visiting a DPRK photo, book and fine art exhibition as follows:
					 The Korean people are strong in principle and sense of justice.
					
					 This is very clear from the fact that they are standing firm against the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their allies to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Not a few countries feel displeased with the U.S. policy of double-standards but dare not stand up against it. 
					
					 The U.S. policy of double-standards proves futile in the DPRK.
					
					 The exhibition took place in Kuwait on March 6 and 7.

articles.title: Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Department Inaugurated at University of Venezuela
articles.content:
Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Department Inaugurated at University of Venezuela
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Department was established at Barquisimeto Liberator Experimental University of Education in Venezuela.
					 Its inaugural ceremony took place at the university on Mar. 15.
					
					 Present there were personages of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Venezuela-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association and teachers and students of the university.
					
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The speakers expressed their joy at having the Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Department at the university, noting that the Korean people made world-startling achievements in building socialism under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea. 
					
					 They went on:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of the President as Kimilsungism and pursued the Songun politics as required by the changed international situation, thus foiling the vicious moves of the U.S.-led international reactionaries to stifle the DPRK and resolutely defending the cause of socialism.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un formulated the preceding leaders' idea as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and clarified its profound essence. All the remarkable achievements in the DPRK are ascribable to the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 They declared that they would push forward the Bolivar revolution to the last by deeply studying Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, disseminating it among broad popular masses and successfully embodying it in Venezuela.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed on March 15 by the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea.
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the group, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events including seminar, reading session and film show on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Tanzania
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Tanzania
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A Tanzanian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Dar es Salaam on March 16.
					 Francis F. Lyimo, chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse events including meeting, lecture and reading session on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated in Romania, Kuwait
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated in Romania, Kuwait
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place in Romania and a DPRK book, photo and fine art exhibition in Kuwait from March 6 to 15 to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun). 
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, praised Kim Il Sung for performing undying feats for the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, he noted, adding:
					
					 The Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania sincerely wishes the Korean people greater successes in their efforts to build a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Abdulreda Assiri, rector of the College of Social Sciences of Kuwait University, said that the DPRK book, photo and fine art exhibition being held at the college on the occasion of the Day of the Sun would mark an important occasion in deepening the friendship between the two peoples.

articles.title: Day of Sun to be Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun to be Celebrated Abroad 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The international preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Sankt-Peterburg of Russia on Mar. 17.
					 A decision on the inauguration of the preparatory committee was announced by the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions.
					
					 According to it, the preparatory committee will hold meeting, photo and book exhibition and film show, conduct information activities by use of media to introduce the DPRK and map out a working plan for activities to support the Korean people in their struggle against the moves of the imperialists and their lackeys.
					
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the above-said International Alliance, was appointed as chairman of the international preparatory committee, Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, as executive secretaries.
					
					 The preparatory committee entrusted the implementation of the working plan to them.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was inaugurated at the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia on Mar. 15.
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from March 15 to April 17 and decided to hold diverse political and cultural events to laud the revolutionary career and feats of the President.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Draw Lesson from Pueblo Incident: Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Draw Lesson from Pueblo Incident: Nigerian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website an article titled "U.S. should draw lesson from Pueblo incident" on March 13.
					 45 years have passed since the Pueblo spy ship case which pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war, the article said, referring in detail to the circumstances of the incident.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Through the Pueblo incident the DPRK fully demonstrated its mettle to settle accounts with those encroaching upon its sovereignty without an inch of concession.
					
					 The U.S. should draw a proper lesson from the Pueblo incident. In the subsequent period, too, it perpetrated ceaseless espionages, military provocations, arms buildup and military exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 Each time the U.S. was sternly punished by the DPRK. It is still busy hatching plots and perpetrating military provocations against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is maintaining a high alert posture, closely watching the moves of the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK's mode of counteraction "React to 'retaliation' with retaliation, a total war with total war" 45 year ago has become unshakable.
					
					 Moreover, the DPRK has emerged a military power and a nuclear weapons state recognized by the world
					
					 The U.S. should never forget the lesson taught by the Pueblo incident 45 years ago.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Favored by Political Parties, Organization of Peru, Spain
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Favored by Political Parties, Organization of Peru, Spain
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organization of Peru and Spain released statements to denounce the U.S. for its hostile policy toward the DPRK as it is staging the provocative Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises and prodded its allies into cooking up the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 The Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru stated on March 14:
					
					1. It resolutely denounces the U.S. provocations against the DPRK.
					
					2. It expresses solidarity for the DPRK government and people who have turned out in the just action to shatter the U.S. moves for a new war.
					
					3. It urges the Peruvian government to denounce the UNSC's "sanctions" against the DPRK and pressurize the U.S. to stop at once provocations against the Korean people.
					
					4. It calls upon progressive political parties and organizations of Peru to urge its government to issue a statement in protest against the moves of the hostile forces for aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The Communist Party of the People of Spain and the Communist Youth Collectives of Spain under the party in their joint statement on the same day said that the satellite launch and underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK are an exercise of the legitimate right by a sovereign state.
					
					 The war maneuvers for aggression being staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces are nuclear war exercises against the DPRK, the statement held.
					
					 It fully supported all the measures taken by the DPRK government to cope with the prevailing situation and extended solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for world peace, national reunification and victory of socialism.

articles.title: U.S. to Blame for Nuclear Issue on Korean Peninsula: Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
U.S. to Blame for Nuclear Issue on Korean Peninsula: Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website an article titled "Arch criminal who spawned nuclear issue on Korean Peninsula" on March 13.
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula was spawned as the U.S. introduced nuclear weapons into south Korea, the article said, and went on:
					
					  After suffering a shameful defeat in the Korean war ignited by itself, the U.S. felt regretful about its failure to use A-bombs during the war. It frantically stepped up the preparations for a nuclear war after the ceasefire.
					
					 The DPRK has made every possible effort to settle the nuclear issue on the peninsula since the U.S. introduction of nuclear weapons into south Korea.
					
					 But the U.S. nuclear threat to the DPRK has not decreased but increased.
					
					 When the first DPRK-U.S. talks started during the Clinton Administration, the U.S. made assurances that it would not use armed forces including nuclear weapons against the DPRK nor threaten it with such forces. It also declared it had no hostile intent on the DPRK. But the U.S. commitments have not yet been honored.
					
					 The Bush Administration singled out the DPRK as an "axis of evil" and a target of preemptive nuclear attack, reneging on the DPRK-U.S. agreements reached during the Clinton Administration.
					
					 This compelled the DPRK to withdraw from NPT and have access to nuclear deterrent for self-defence.
					
					 At the six-party talks, too, the U.S. confirmed that it has no intention to attack or invade the DPRK with nuclear or conventional weapons. It promised several times to improve relations with the DPRK and opt for establishing full diplomatic relations with it.
					
					 But the U.S. did not keep its promise this time, too, but escalated its offensive to stifle the DPRK, straining the situation on the peninsula.
					
					 As all facts prove, it is none other than the U.S. which spawned the nuclear issue on the peninsula and escalated the tension.
					
					 The U.S. is, therefore, wholly to blame for the nuclear issue on the peninsula.

articles.title: Korean People Are Sure to Win in Confrontation with U.S.: Romanian Figures
articles.content:
Korean People Are Sure to Win in Confrontation with U.S.: Romanian Figures
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Romanian figures issued statements on March 13 and 14 in protest against the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union, said that the U.S. kicked off the large-scale military exercises in the waters off the Korean Peninsula and prodded its allies into cooking up the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions". This is a grave provocation threatening peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and a vivid expression of its hostile policy toward the DPRK, he noted, adding:
					
					 In view of the prevailing situation a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army declared the Korean Armistice Agreement invalid. This is a very just measure for self-defence to cope with the U.S. provocation.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities should stop at once the hostile acts against the DPRK, bearing in mind that neither threat nor blackmail works on the Korean people.
					
					 The U.S. should withdraw all its aggressor forces including nuclear weapons from south Korea pronto.
					
					 We positively support the just cause of the Korean people waging an indomitable struggle despite the ever-escalating provocations of the imperialist allied forces and will always fight shoulder to shoulder in the same trench of the anti-imperialist front.
					
					 Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, said that the joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. are a revelation of the hostile policy of the U.S. and its allies toward the DPRK, a policy aimed to ignite the second Korean war at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. madcap moves for a war are wrecking global peace and security, the statement noted, strongly demanding an immediate halt to the moves.
					
					 The heroic Korean people will certainly emerge victorious in the confrontation with the U.S. and achieve national reunification, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos al campo de roturacion de meseta de Sepho
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos al campo de roturacion de meseta de Sepho
						
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, quien habia dispensado muchos beneficios a los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea y constructores movilizados en la roturacion de la meseta de Sepho, en respuesta al llamamiento del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, depositandoles gran confianza, envio a ellos muchos medios de transporte, materiales agricolas y articulos de vida.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en el terreno la ceremonia de entrega de regalos. 
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y otros funcionarios, los militares del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los constructores y trabajadores del distrito de Sepho.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias por deceso de presidente de Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias por deceso de presidente de Bangladesh
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, remitio el dia 21 un mensaje de condolencias a Sheikh Hasina, premier de la Republica Popular de Bangladesh, con motivo del fallecimiento del presidente de ese pais Zillur Rahman.
					Segun el texto, informado de la triste noticia sobre el deceso lamentable del mandatario de Bangladesh, el remitente expresa profundas condolencias a la destinataria y por su conducto, a los familiares del fallecido y pueblo de Bangladesh.
					
					Puntualiza que a pesar del deceso, quedaran para siempre en el alma de los pueblos las proezas del fallecido acumuladas ante la patria y la nacion.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam desea exitos de trabajo al presidente Pakistani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam desea exitos de trabajo al presidente pakistani
						
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de Pakistan, Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion a Asif Ali Zardari, presidente de la Republica Islamica de Pakistan.
					En su misiva, el remitente manifiesta la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran en el futuro tambien las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Pakistan y desea al destinatario y el pueblo pakistani mayores exitos en sus labores para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim averigua estado de administracion combinada de silvicultura y agricultura
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim averigua estado de administracion combinada de silvicultura y agricultura
						
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Yong Rim, averiguo en el terreno el estado de la aplicacion del metodo de administracion combinada de silvicultura y agricultura en el distrito de Suan de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					  Los funcionarios y trabajadores agricolas del distrito de Suan aplicaron el metodo de administracion combinada de silvicultura y agricultura, nuevo tipo de la administracion forestal que posibilita mejorar el ambiente ecologico y producir los cereales y varias materias primas industriales cultivando en el suelo forestal los arboles, los cultivos, las plantas medicinales, etc. en cooperacion con el Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental.
					
					  El premier se entero en detalles del estado de plantacion de alerces y pinos pinoneros y el cultivo de maiz y otros cereales en ese distrito.
					
					  Vio el video alusivo a este metodo preparado por el Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental.
					
					  En la reunion, Choe subrayo la necesidad de aplicar activamente este metodo que se comprobo su eficacia real, hacer verde las montanas en un corto plazo y contribuir a la mejora de vida del pueblo en pleno acato al legado de los grandes Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il de convertir todos los montes del pais en ricos recursos naturales y al gran proyecto del Mariscal Kim Jong Un sobre la gran transformacion de la naturaleza.

articles.title: MINREX de RPDC rechaza "resolucion" del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU
articles.content:
MINREX de RPDC rechaza "resolucion" del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU
						
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada el dia 22 por la ACNC en relacion con que en la sesion del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU quedo aprobada una "resolucion" tan provocativa contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					El dia 21, fue aprobada en la 22a sesion del citado consejo la "resolucion" cuyo contenido es organizar el "comision de investigacion" adhiriendose a los datos falsificados e inventados que difaman y calumnian la RPDC.
					
					No vale nada la aprobacion de "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC que libraban cada ano Estados Unidos y las fuerzas seguidoras con la hostilidad a la RPDC.
					
					En estos dias, EE.UU., que esta en aprietos debido a sucesivas derrotas en el enfrentamiento politico y militar con la RPDC, instiga las fuerzas satelites a armar alboroto de DDHH anti-RPDC.
					
					Al igual que en el pasado, rechazamos totalmente la presente "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC, producto de la confrontacion y conspiracion politicas y la tratamos con desprecio.
					
					Desde el periodo de la guerra fria, EE.UU. y el Occidente calumniaban los paises socialistas so pretexto del "problema de DDHH". Por eso, la aprobacion de susodicha "resolucion", siendo producto de tal vicio inveterado, demuestra solo su bajeza y vulgaridad de ellos que abusan de DDHH, noble concepcion de la humanidad, para el malsano objetivo politico.
					
					Para cumplir con su mision, el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU debe poner fin a la aprobacion de la "resolucion de DDHH" contra la RPDC, que es el climax de politizacion de DDHH, la opcion y la pauta de doble rasero y cuestionar ante todo la violacion de EE.UU. a la soberania del Estado que se comente por doquier del mundo.
					
					Hoy dia, en los paises que se han convertido en escenas caoticas debido a la agresion y la intervencion de las fuerzas foraneas, persiguen  circulos viciosos de terror y venganza y la tragica situacion de DDHH que causa grave preocupacion de la sociedad internacional, lo cual demuestra fehacientemente cuan grave es  la consecuencia de la violacion a la soberania del Estado.
					
					Cuanto mas crece la hostilidad de EE.UU. tendente a aplastar la idea y el regimen optados por nuestro pueblo, tanto mas se elevara la intensidad de la confrontacion total antiyanqui de la RPDC.

articles.title: Cuadros recorren exposicion nacional de articulos de consumo popular
articles.content:
Cuadros recorren exposicion nacional de articulos de consumo popular
						
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, ministerios y organos centrales recorrieron los dias 20 y 22 la sede de exposicion nacional de articulos de consumo popular.
					En la feria, inaugurada en la capitalina Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones, se exhibieron mas de 142 mil articulos de consumo popular presentados por las fabricas de la rama de industria ligera y las unidades productoras de articulos de primera necesidad en la capital y las localidades.
					
					Los visitantes pasaron revista a los mostradores llenos de los productos de vinalon, las telas de terciopelo, calzados, ropas, uniformes deportivos, alimentos, cosmeticos y articulos de uso domestico producidos en las fabricas textiles y de tejidos de seda, las otras de tricotaje y de ropas, las fabricas de zapatos y las otras de alimentos y articulos de uso diario.
					
					Obtuvieron el visto bueno de los visitantes los productos presentados por el distrito de Changsong y los combinados de alimentos de todas las provincias que contribuyeron grandemente a la produccion de articulos de consumo popular mediante el desarrollo de industria local.
					
					Variados articulos de consumo, hechos movilizando la creatividad de las masas y las reservas internas, comprobaron la justeza y la vitalidad del movimiento por la produccion de los articulos de consumo popular 3 de Agosto.
